Description: Fan-handle, with modern ostrich feathers attached. A plain wooden handle is topped with a finely carved terminal. This bears a carved depiction of the face of Hathor, with cow ears. The top of the terminal is pierced with holes to take the feathers.
Curator's comments: For a simpler, wooden, fan handle, see Egypt’s Golden Age (exhibition catalogue, Boston, 1982): 179 [no.205] (with reference to excavated examples and depictions in tomb paintings).
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
